weka.classifiers.collective.util

Class Flipper

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.collective.util.Flipper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, OptionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfidentFlipper, SimpleFlipper, TriangleFlipper

    public abstract class Flipper
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, OptionHandler
    Abstract class for algorithms that flip labels according to a certain function.

    Version:
    $Revision: 2019 $
    Author:
    FracPete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the OptionHandler's options using the given list. All options will be set (or reset) during this call (i.e., incremental setting of options is not possible). Available options:

        -D
        turns on output of debugging information

        Specified by:
        setOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Parameters:
        options - the list of options as an array of strings
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported

      • getOptions

        Gets the current option settings for the OptionHandler.
        Specified by:
        getOptions in interface OptionHandler
        Returns:
        the list of current option settings as an array of strings

      • flipLabel

        public abstract double flipLabel(Classifier c,
                                 Instances instances,
                                 int from,
                                 int count,
                                 int index,
                                 FlipHistory history)
        returns the (possibly) new class label. The Random number generator must be set before!
        Parameters:
        c - the Classifier to use for prediction
        instances - the instances to use for flipping
        from - the starting of flipping
        count - the number of instances to flip
        index - the index of the instance to flip
        history - the flipping history
        Returns:
        the (possibly) new class label
        See Also:
        setRandom(Random)

      • assign

        public void assign(Flipper f)
        sets all the options from the given flipping algorithm
        Parameters:
        f - the flipper to get the options from

      • forName

        public static Flipper forName(java.lang.String classname,
                              java.lang.String[] options)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        generates a new flip algorithm instance, based on the classname and the given options
        Parameters:
        classname - the classname of the flip algorithm to create
        options - (optional) options for the algorithm
        Returns:
        the flipping algorithm
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if creation fails
